TopicTitle: [1.2.2] Phoenix Industries Cargo Resupply System (KIS/MechJeb Compatible) v2.2

Articles.Content: Does anyone knows if this mod works well in KSP 1.2.2?

> 
> 
> On 10/5/2016 at 11:28 AM, FiiZzioN said:
> 
> 
> I don't know if this is a bug on my end, or if the ATV's solar panels are buggy. Whenever I use them, they angle themselves edge-first towards the sun, just like a radiator would. Pics in the album so you can see what I'm talking about. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [Album link is here!](http://imgur.com/a/8WI9J)
> 

Any idea when the ATV's panels will be fixed?

Hey everyone, sorry for the absence. I've been really busy with my podcast, school, a new short film, and finding composing work.  

I plan to update this very soon. The update will just include some config tweaks and hopefully I'll finally fix the blasted solar panels. Have I mentioned that I hate making solar panels?! I may also do that nosecone that I've been getting a lot of requests for.  

In the meantime, I've tested against 1.2.2 and everything works (besides ATV panels).

What did you mean as a CRS-4?

If you want to transfer fuel to a station, I would just attach a fuel tank to the CRS capsule instead of the cargo trunk. 

Or did you mean using the trunk model but having it contain multiple switchable resources?

Ah I see. The current method would be to use <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> to store fuel tanks in the ATV, then EVA when its docked and remove the tanks, attach to your station and transfer, but that's a bit tedious. Maybe I'll look into it.

Ripping out the <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> space and figuring out how to <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch for Configurable Containers (though that would probably be good to package on your side as a little bonus gift for people?)

New version is on SpaceDock!  

Changelog:  

-Switched all textures to .DDS  

-Added NoseCone for Phoenix capsule.  

-Fixed ATV solar panels (so they now work as intended)  

-Tweaked Cygnus model so flag decal is transparent if not in use.
Can we expect TAC support any time soon?

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, redmonddkgamer said:
> 
> 
> Can we expect TAC support any time soon?
> 

What sort of TAC support? swapping out one storage for a different one?

> 
> 
> On 03/02/2017 at 6:32 PM, WuphonsReach said:
> 
> 
> What sort of TAC support? swapping out one storage for a different one?
> 

Like swapping the <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> for life support containers, or removing some of the <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> inventory to make room for a smaller TAC container.

> 
> 
> On 06/02/2017 at 6:38 AM, WuphonsReach said:
> 
> 
> Those changes are pretty easy to do with a <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch (although I'm not using those specific parts yet in my current career).  You can create the .cfg file anywhere under the GameData/ folder.  I suggest creating a sub-folder under GameData/ to hold your personal <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patches.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> You'll need something that [looks like](https://github.com/WuphonsReach/KSP-ScrapyardBob/blob/master/Squad/CommandModules/Mark1-2Pod.cfg):
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     
>     
>     +PART[Mark1-2Pod]
>     {
>         @name = SYB_Squad_Mark1-2Pod
>     
>         @entryCost += 4500 // I typically do 3000 + 1500 per extra
>         @cost += 980 // 440 (2x Z1k) + 270 (1x Stratus V)
>         @mass += 0.35 // 0.05t (1x Z1k) + 0.15 (1x Stratus V)
>     
>         %RESOURCE[MonoPropellant]{	// Add (1) Stratus V	@amount += 150	@maxAmount += 150}
>     !PROPELLANT[Oxidizer] {}
>     }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> The first line is the part name that you want to clone (taken from its .cfg file definition).
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Third line gives it a new name (which must be unique).
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Then I adjust the entryCost (purchase cost in R&D), the part cost and part mass.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> The "%RESOURCE[]{}" block adds or edits monoprop to the part.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> The "!tag[]{}" line can be used to remove the part.  Although I have not used that yet in my games, it can be used to remove any node (such as a "MODULE[name]{}").
> 
> 
> 
> 
> For debugging, you should search the contents of KSP.log for the new part name, and also look in the ModuleManager.ConfigCache file for the new part name.
> 

Could you be more specific on how to add appropriate amounts of TAC resources? I don't have very much experience with CFGs at all, the furthest I have gone is dicking around with engine thrust and fuel capacities, so if you could supply something I could just copy-paste into the config, that would be great. I also think that the owner needs to add built in TACLSS support, or some other widely used life support mod, like Snacks or <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Life Support.

> 
> 
> On 2/7/2017 at 8:55 AM, redmonddkgamer said:
> 
> 
> Could you be more specific on how to add appropriate amounts of TAC resources? I don't have very much experience with CFGs at all, the furthest I have gone is dicking around with engine thrust and fuel capacities, so if you could supply something I could just copy-paste into the config, that would be great. I also think that the owner needs to add built in TACLSS support, or some other widely used life support mod, like Snacks or <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Life Support.
> 

I'll see what I can do this week, first I need to figure out which parts are here, what their capacity is, and a few other things.

Looking through the part .cfg files, I only see (4) things:

1. ATV - <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> storage, 30,000 units
2. Cygnus - <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> storage, 1500 units
3. HTV - <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> storage, 15,000 units
4. PI-CRS-1 Phoenix Capsule - <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>, 3600 units

I need to look at them in-game to see if those amounts make sense or if I should adjust them before doing <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS versions.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-02-13T23:18:03Z" title="02/13/2017 11:18  PM" data-short="7 yr">February 13, 2017</time> by WuphonsReach**

> 
> 
> On 1/3/2017 at 11:59 AM, Jivaii said:
> 
> 
> Other then that, what are the odds of possibly getting a CRS-4 capable of hauling tanks? I'd like to utilize it as an emergency fuel drop sometimes. Or as a good solid way to move fertilizer up to my stations for <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS. Like how the current CRS missions take food and water up to the station.
> 

First draft version of a Firespitter-driven cargo-switching ATV (CRS-4) module.

[https://github.com/WuphonsReach/KSP-ScrapyardBob/blob/master/CTN-PhoenixIndustries/CRS/ctn_atv.cfg](https://github.com/WuphonsReach/KSP-ScrapyardBob/blob/master/CTN-PhoenixIndustries/CRS/ctn_atv.cfg)

You can put that .cfg file anywhere under your GameData/ directory and it will add two versions of the PI-CRS-4 to the game if you have Firespitter and CommunityResourcePack installed (both are packaged with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>'s FTT release).  The two new versions are a liquids tank and a solids tank (and removes the <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> inventory from those variants).

Note:  Firespitter hides the built-in monoprop tanks and EC batteries in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>.  However, those hidden resources still exist and will show up once you roll out to the launch pad.

I don't have TAC-LS installed, but I could do something similar there (probably a 3rd version).

**Edited <time datetime="2017-02-17T16:21:22Z" title="02/17/2017 04:21  PM" data-short="7 yr">February 17, 2017</time> by WuphonsReach**
[@-ctn-](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/130898-ctn/) Is there a github repo where I could submit a PR for <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patches?

So, with Firespitter and the fuel switching -- it will hide any existing resources (in this case, EC and monoprop) when you first build the rocket in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>.  However, those resources are still in the part and will show up after you save the rocket, exit the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>, re-enter the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> and load your rocket back from its save file.

Just one small oddity that I'm not sure if it's worth addressing (or using a different fuel-switcher, but Firespitter is what is packaged with the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>/MKS stuff).

Alot of mods use Interstellar Fuel Switch, and configurable Containers is an upcoming mod, and likely to get used in <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> at some point as [@allista](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/99885-allista/)'s ground construction mod is now being used by <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>.

Yeah, I'll need to make alternate configs with IFS or B9 or something else.

Here is a lander that ferries <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS Supplies up from the surface of the Mun or Minmus and takes <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS Mulch back down for processing.  This design has a MKS Logistics module on it, so it can be crewed by a Pilot or Quartermaster and can pull from MKS Planetary Logistics (and push, but that just requires an uncrewed Logistics module).

**Edited <time datetime="2017-02-18T01:10:53Z" title="02/18/2017 01:10  AM" data-short="7 yr">February 18, 2017</time> by WuphonsReach**

I do feel like the base CRS-4 with only 40 EC is a bit limited and I always have to strap on extra batteries.  Given the 8t mass, I recommend increasing the EC capacity into the 500-2000 range.

(In contrast, the 500 units of Monoprop is very good.  I've not needed to strap on extra MP tanks.)
[@-ctn-](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/130898-ctn/) any news of updates?
